section.title: Web Service Command Line Interface
section.para: The Command Line Interface (CLI) is fast way to work with the web services, It Consist in a set of tools can be use to perform basic operations like:

listitem.para: Create, Update, Read, List and Delete web services based on YAML files.
Read the Debugger log, with filter options.

note.para: There is another option instead of the CLI to work with web services. Integrated to the Admin interface there are is a complete set of screens to interact with every part of the web service. Please read the web service GUI section included in this manual.

section.title: Web Service Configuration
section.para: The "WebserviceConfig.pl" was developed thinking in a basic, but fast and powerful tool to work with web service configurations, it give you the ability to perform following actions:

listitem.para: Add: to create web services using a YAML file as the configuration source.
Update: to change an existing web service, the configuration can be changed using a different or modified YAML file.
Read: to get the current web service configuration displayed on the screen.
List: to get a complete list of all the web services registered in system.
Delete: to delete a web service from the system, be careful when you use it, because this action can't be undone.

warning.para: A web service READ operation will display all the configuration as plain text on the screen even stored passwords, please be aware of it and take the needed precautions when you use it.

Also you can use 'otrs.WebserviceConfig.pl' with following options:
-a read -i <webservice_id> - To read a stored configuration.
-a write -n <webservice_name> -f /path/to/yaml/file - To create a new web service.
-a write -i <webservice_id> -f /path/to/yaml/file - To update a web service.
-a list - To list available web services.
-a delete -i <webservice_id> - To delete a web service.

itemizedlist.para: Optional parameters can be used for "otrs.GenericInterfaceDebugRead.pl" script, they are listed below:

listitem.para: -c - to filter by Communication ID (md5sum format).
-a - to filter by date (At or After a date).
-b - to filter by date (At or Before a date).
-i - to filter by IP Address (must be valid IPv4 or IPv6 address).
-w - to filter by Web Service ID.
